name: Prajakta Nimbhorkar
content: Prajakta Nimbhorkar's home page Welcome to my homepage Contact Information Academic Background Teaching Post-docs, Ph.D and M.Sc. students Research Interests Publications Contact Information Prajakta Nimbhorkar Professor G Chennai Mathematical Institute Plot H1, SIPCOT IT Park Padur PO, Siruseri 603103 India Email: my first name % cmi % ac % in (Replace % with appropriate characters and insert my first name) Academic Background 2007-2010: Ph.D.(Computer Science) at The Institute of Mathematical Sciences, Chennai (... continued from TIFR) Thesis Advisor: Prof. Meena Mahajan Thesis Title: Complexity analysis of some problems in planar graphs, bounded tree-width graphs, and planar point sets 2005-2007: JRF (Computer Science) at Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Mumbai 2003-2005: M.Tech.(IT) from Kanwal Rekhi School of IT, IIT Bombay 1999-2003 : B.E. (CSE) from Govt. College of Engineering, Aurangabad 1999: H.S.C. from Saraswati Bhuwan College of Science, Aurangabad 1997: S.S.C. from Sharda Mandir Girls' School, Aurangabad Teaching Algorithmic Game Theory Fall 2025 Topics in Algorithms: Advanced design and analysis techniques Spring 2025 Design and Analysis of Algorithms Spring 2012 (Course for Msc 1st year, Applications of Mathematics class) Fall 2012 Fall 2014 Fall 2016 Spring 2016 (For M.Sc. Log-space Algorithms for Paths and Matchings in k-trees Samir Datta and Bireswar Das and Prajakta Nimbhorkar Theory of Computing Systems. (A preliminary version appeared in STACS 2010.) Isomorphism for K_{3,3}-free and K_5-free graphs is in Log-space Samir Datta and Prajakta Nimbhorkar and Thomas Thierauf and Fabian Wagner FSTTCS 2009. The planar k-means problem is NP-hard Meena Mahajan and Prajakta Nimbhorkar and Kasturi R. Varadarajan. To appear in Theoretical Computer Science, special issue for WALCOM 2009. A preliminary version appeared in Proceedings of 3rd Annual Workshop on Algorithms and Computation WALCOM, 18-20 Feb 2009, Kolkata. Longest Paths in Planar DAGs in Unambiguous Logspace Nutan Limaye and Meena Mahajan and Prajakta Nimbhorkar. In Chicago Journal of Theoretical Computer Science CATS 2009 special issue, 2010(8), 2010.A preliminary version appeared in Computing: The Australasian Theory Symposium CATS , January 2009, New Zealand. A preliminary version with a subset of these results appears as a technical report on the Computing Research Repository:arXiv:0802.1699v1, 2008. 3-connected planar graph isomorphism is in Logspace Samir Datta and Nutan Limaye and Prajakta Nimbhorkar. In Proceedings of Foundations of Software Technology and Theoretical Computer Science, FST & TCS, 2008.
